Predicate-denotes.label: denotes
Predicate-denotes.description: The predicate 'denotes' connects a subject to an object by indicating that the subject represents or stands for the object. In general, it implies a relationship of reference or correspondence between the two entities.

Predicate-is_part_of.label: is part of
Predicate-is_part_of.description: The predicate 'is part of' indicates a relationship where the subject is an integral component or element within the object. The object represents a larger whole, and the subject is one of its constituent parts.

Predicate-apply_with.label: apply with
Predicate-apply_with.description: To use or utilize a subject's capabilities to process, analyze, or manipulate an object. The predicate 'apply with' indicates that the subject is being employed to perform some action on the object.

Predicate-would_like_to_find_out.label: would like to find out
Predicate-would_like_to_find_out.description: Expresses a desire for knowledge or information about something. The subject of the sentence has an interest in discovering more about the object, which represents some aspect or characteristic that they wish to understand better.

Predicate-find_out.label: find out
Predicate-find_out.description: To 'find out' means to discover or learn something previously unknown or unclear about a subject. Predicate-use_for.label: use for
Predicate-use_for.description: The predicate 'use for' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject is employed or utilized to achieve a specific purpose or function described by the object. In general, this predicate suggests that the subject serves as a means to accomplish something defined by the object.

Predicate-like_to_find_out.label: like to find out
Predicate-like_to_find_out.description: The predicate 'like to find out' indicates a subject's interest or curiosity in discovering information about an object. It suggests that the subject has a desire to learn more, investigate further, or uncover details about the object.

Predicate-are_conducted_with.label: are conducted with
Predicate-are_conducted_with.description: The predicate 'are conducted with' indicates a relationship of association or accompaniment between two entities. It suggests that the subject (in this case, research proposals) are accompanied by or performed alongside the object (experiments), implying a connection or integration between them.

Predicate-are_randomly_selected_for.label: are randomly selected for
Predicate-are_randomly_selected_for.description: The predicate 'are randomly selected for' indicates a process of choosing or selecting entities (in this case, 99 research proposals) that are suitable or relevant to a particular purpose or context (model training). Predicate-is_analyzed_by.label: is analyzed by
Predicate-is_analyzed_by.description: The predicate 'is analyzed by' indicates a relationship where the subject (a process or method) has been examined and understood through the application of an analytical tool or technique represented by the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests that the analysis was performed using the specified methodology, providing insight into how the subject functions or operates.

Predicate-contribute_to_reducing.label: contribute to reducing
Predicate-contribute_to_reducing.description: To connect a subject with an object by indicating that the subject plays a role in diminishing or decreasing the magnitude of something undesirable, such as errors, impurities, or problems. Predicate-analyse.description: To examine or investigate a subject (or data) to identify patterns, relationships, and/or underlying structures, often with the goal of gaining insights, making predictions, or drawing conclusions.

Predicate-conduct.label: conduct
Predicate-conduct.description: To conduct means to take charge of and oversee the execution or performance of an action, process, or activity. Predicate-is_to_determine_whether_there_.label: is to determine whether there is a relation between
Predicate-is_to_determine_whether_there_.description: This predicate indicates an inquiry or investigation aimed at identifying a connection or correlation between two entities (represented by the object), based on information provided by the subject. Predicate-has_a_relation_with.label: has a relation with
Predicate-has_a_relation_with.description: Indicates that there exists some connection or association between two entities (subject and object), which can be characterized by shared properties, categories, concepts, or relationships.

Predicate-is_trained_based_on.label: is trained based on
Predicate-is_trained_based_on.description: The predicate 'is trained based on' indicates that the subject (a proposed model or a machine learning algorithm) has been developed using the object as its foundation, guidance, or inspiration. Predicate-falls_within_the_range_of.label: falls within the range of
Predicate-falls_within_the_range_of.description: The predicate 'falls within the range of' indicates a relationship between the subject (a set or category of entities) and the object (a defined scope, boundary, or threshold), suggesting that the subject's characteristics, properties, or values are contained within or conform to the specifications outlined by the object. Predicate-by_testing.label: by testing

Predicate-stores_JSON_files_based_on_pro.label: stores JSON files based on proposal index
Predicate-stores_JSON_files_based_on_pro.description: This predicate indicates that a subject organizes and saves data in JSON file format according to an indexing system or criteria defined by a proposal. Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' connects the subject to a detailed or comprehensive explanation of its object. It indicates that the subject provides an account, outline, or summary of the object's characteristics, features, or nature.

Predicate-applied_to_implement.label: applied to implement
Predicate-applied_to_implement.description: The predicate 'applied to implement' indicates that a subject (e.g., a tool or technology) was used as part of the process to design and develop an object (e.g., a system, algorithm, or model). Predicate-implemented_by.label: implemented by
Predicate-implemented_by.description: The predicate 'implemented by' indicates a relationship between an entity (subject) and its underlying mechanism or tool that brings it into existence. It suggests that the subject's functionality, behavior, or characteristics are made possible through the object, which serves as the means of implementation.

Predicate-is_used_to_implement.label: is used to implement
Predicate-is_used_to_implement.description: This predicate indicates that a linguistic tool or framework (subject) serves as the means of achieving or realizing a specific computational concept or technique (object). Predicate-is_a_significant_step_in_apply.label: is a significant step in applying
Predicate-is_a_significant_step_in_apply.description: This predicate indicates that the subject represents an important or crucial action taken to achieve the object. Predicate-need_to_implement.label: need to implement
Predicate-need_to_implement.description: To indicate a requirement or obligation for the subject to take action and put into practice or apply the object. The predicate 'need to implement' implies that there is a necessity, urgency, or importance attached to the implementation of the object.

Predicate-defined_for.label: defined for
Predicate-defined_for.description: The predicate 'defined for' indicates a relationship between the subject and object where the subject specifies or determines the scope or range within which the object applies, operates, or has meaning.

Predicate-make.label: make
Predicate-make.description: The predicate 'make' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject has an influence on or brings about the state described by the object, often implying a transformation or creation of something.

Predicate-values_for.label: values for
Predicate-values_for.description: The predicate 'values for' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g., parameter) provides or assigns specific values to achieve or attain the object (e.g., each accuracy). Predicate-set_as_follows.label: set as follows
Predicate-set_as_follows.description: The predicate 'set as follows' indicates a specific configuration or setup for achieving a particular outcome. It connects the subject (the action or process) to the object (a set of parameters, values, or settings), implying that these specifications are necessary or recommended in order to accomplish the task described by the subject.

Predicate-adopt.label: adopt
Predicate-adopt.description: To adopt means to take on or assume a particular approach, method, or standard as one's own. It implies a deliberate and intentional decision to use or follow something, often in order to achieve a specific goal or outcome.

Predicate-applied_in.label: applied in
Predicate-applied_in.description: The predicate 'applied in' indicates a relationship where the subject (a method or technique) was used to achieve or accomplish something described by the object. Predicate-evaluate_the_performance_of.label: evaluate the performance of
Predicate-evaluate_the_performance_of.description: To assess and quantify the effectiveness or quality of a process, method, system, or technique by comparing its actual output to expected standards or benchmarks.

Predicate-used_to_find.label: used to find
Predicate-used_to_find.description: The predicate 'used to find' indicates a purpose or function that connects the subject (e.g., RF classifiers) with an object (e.g., the best combination of parameter and target value). Predicate-have_different_settings_of.label: have different settings of

Predicate-.description: Assigns or equates a value to another. This predicate indicates that the subject and object are equal or identical, often used for setting parameters or variables.

Predicate-show.description: To indicate or demonstrate something's existence, relevance, or significance by revealing a connection or relationship between two entities. Predicate-can_be_understood_as.label: can be understood as

Predicate-generated_by.label: generated by
Predicate-generated_by.description: The predicate 'generated by' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object, suggesting that the subject was created or produced as a result of some process or entity represented by the object. Predicate-than_that_of.label: than that of
Predicate-than_that_of.description: The predicate 'than that of' indicates a comparison between two entities or concepts, with the subject being one entity and the object representing another. Predicate-are_still_crucial_because.label: are still crucial because

Predicate-provide_insight_into.label: provide insight into

Predicate-correlates_with.label: correlates with

Predicate-have_a_correlation_with.label: have a correlation with

Predicate-can_better_predict.label: can better predict

Predicate-predicts_close_to.label: predicts close to

Predicate-reach_an_accuracy_of_82.5.label: reach an accuracy of 82.5%

Predicate-is_an.description: The predicate 'is an' indicates a classification or categorization relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject belongs to or falls within the category denoted by the object, implying a sense of membership, similarity, or equivalence.

Predicate-achieves_an_accuracy_of_84.17.label: achieves an accuracy of 84.17%

Predicate-can_be_carried_out_from.label: can be carried out from

Predicate-should_not_be.label: should not be
Predicate-should_not_be.description: The predicate 'should not be' indicates a negative relationship between the subject and object. Predicate-perform_well_in.label: perform well in

Predicate-introduces.label: introduces

Predicate-proposes.label: proposes

Predicate-assist_in_reviewing.label: assist in reviewing

Predicate-assist_in_predicting.label: assist in predicting
